info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued August 15 at 12:02PM CDT until August 16 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi TX
info.description:
...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 AM CDT SATURDAY...
* WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected.
* WHERE...Kleberg Islands and Nueces Islands Counties.
* WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Saturday evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 9 AM CDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Rip currents can sweep even the most experienced swimmers away from shore into deeper water. These rip currents can become life-threatening to anyone entering the surf.
info.instruction:
If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
